author: senh
title: Airline Fares Record Steepest Drop in 20 Years
text: BING NEWS: Airline Fares Record Steepest Drop in 20 Years on Declining Fuel Costs Consumer prices may have ticked slightly higher in July, but not for everything. Airline fares recorded their steepest monthly decline in 20 years, falling 5.6 percent last month, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. "The one thing I'm surprised ... 08/19/2015 - 5:35 am | View Link US probing possible airline collusion that kept fares high That has led to record profits. In the past two years, U.S. airlines earned a combined $19.7 billion. This year could bring even higher profits thanks to a massive drop in the price of ... setting unrealistically low fares to lure passengers. 07/1/2015 - 2:45 pm | View Link Shares in strike-hit Aer Lingus fall as airline cuts its earnings forecast Aer Lingus CEO Christoph Mueller Aer Lingus planes at Dublin Airport Christoph Mueller, chief executive officer of Aer Lingus Group Plc SHARES in strike-hit Aer Lingus and its part owner Ryanair suffered yesterday as the former state carrier cut its ... 06/12/2014 - 6:26 pm | View Link Airline Industry Outlook In a major turnaround, the airline industry recorded $16 billion in profits last year ... European airlinesâ€™ profits are expected to drop to $500 million in 2011 from $1.4 billion in 2010. The African air carriers are expected to break even in 2011 ... 04/12/2011 - 8:53 am | View Link Book your airline tickets! Travel is cheaper for now, but it may rise in 2010 American Express predicts that domestic short-trip airfares will rise between 2 percent and 7 percent while international business fares will increase from 3 percent to 8 percent.
